multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have circular, ashy-gray spots on my back and chest.
How long have you had these spots?
I've had them for about 2 years.
Have the spots changed in size or number over the 2 years?
The borders of the spots, which were initially red, have faded over the past several months, but no mention of changes in size or number.
Do the spots itch or cause any irritation?
No, the spots do not cause any pain or itching.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for these spots? If so, what were they and did they have any effect?
No, I haven't taken any medication for the spots.
Do you have a history of similar skin issues in your family?
There is no mention of a family history of similar skin issues.
Final Diagnosis: Tinea Versicolor
